title.text: Mental Distress Detection and Triage in Forum Posts: The LT3 CLPsych 2016 Shared Task System

abstractContent.text: This paper describes the contribution of LT3 for the CLPsych 2016 Shared Task on automatic triage of mental health forum posts.

entities.text: automatic triage of mental health forum posts

abstractContent.text: Our systems use multiclass Support Vector Machines (SVM), cascaded binary SVMs and ensembles with a rich feature set.
The best systems obtain macro-averaged F-scores of 40% on the full task and 80% on the green versus alarming distinction.
Multiclass SVMs with all features score best in terms of F-score, whereas feature filtering with bi-normal separation and classifier ensembling are found to improve recall of alarming posts.

introductionContent.text: The 2016 ACL Workshop on Computational Linguistics and Clinical Psychology included a shared task focusing on triage classification in forum posts from ReachOut.com, an online service for youth mental health issues.

entities.text: ACL Workshop on Computational Linguistics and Clinical Psychology

introductionContent.text: The aim is to automatically classify an unseen post as one of four categories indicating the severity of mental distress.
ReachOut staff has annotated a corpus of posts with crisis/red/amber/green semaphore labels that indicate how urgently a post needs moderator attention.
The system described in this paper is based on a suicidality classification system intended for Dutch social media).
Therefore, we approach the current mental distress triage task from a suicide detection standpoint.
